name: Hobgoblin
overview: Hobgoblin was programmed by David Parsons, developed by Pantheon Software and published by Atlantis. Made originally for the BBC Micro and Acorn Electron, which didn't receive any official port of Ghosts 'n Goblins, the game was successful enough to be ported to several other platforms. In 2008, Hobgoblin was even ported, with the blessing of the original author, to the Atari 8-bit series of computers, which never received a port back when the game was new.
